name: TS Files
tagline: Everything about ts files  and associated codecs
body:
Some Important Links:

http://www.bretl.com/mpeghtml/MPEGindex.htm(consider this a benchmark)
http://downloads.bbc.co.uk/rd/pubs/reports/1996-01.pdf
http://downloads.bbc.co.uk/rd/pubs/reports/1996-02.pdf
http://downloads.bbc.co.uk/rd/pubs/reports/1996-03.pdf

# Some Definitions:

Entropy: The smallest theoretically achievable average word length for lossless compression is equal to the entropy of the source. Further compression is possible only if it is lossy.

Pixel: A small point in an image. For example: ARGB requires 4 bytes for each pixel(1 byte a(alpha), r, g, b). YUV420 requires 6 bytes per 4 pixels.

__ Elementary Streams: 
        Every ES is a pid in TS. Thumb rule: If something has a pid it is an ES. PAT is an ES, PMT is an ES etc.
        All ES are packetised into PES. An ES can be divided into multiple PES. The PES might be intermixed, e.g. a, v, a, a, a, v, v, v, a, PAT, PMT. 
PES generally have a fixed length apart from a case of a video ES.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
